intro: Jacksonia effusa, commonly known as the common thistle, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant features spiny, lobed leaves and produces small, yellowish flower heads that bloom in spring. It thrives in a variety of habitats, including grasslands and forest margins. Jacksonia effusa is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
